revised_title: Gamma-Ray Astronomy: Gamma-Rays from Cosmic-Ray Irradiated Molecular Clouds
tldr: This article examines the contribution of discrete sources of gamma-rays from cosmic rays interacting with molecular clouds in the galaxy. It focuses on nearby clouds and a Monte-Carlo analysis of general clouds. The authors compare their findings with previous experiments and discuss the possibility of stellar winds causing gamma-rays. They present evidence against this idea using the Orion nebula and the Gum nebula.
